pattern.message: Please enter a valid host (examples: localhost example.com some.example.com)
Please enter a valid domain (examples: http://www.example.com example.com localhost:8080)

field.name: description
field.value: If set to true, the name of the currently selected tab is being appended to the URL as a get-parameter. Addresses the issue that IE loses the anchor on a redirect.

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "#{shortName}"?

field.name: description
field.value: If set to true, the name of the currently selected tab is being appended to the URL as a get-parameter. Addresses the issue that IE loses the anchor on a redirect.

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "appendTabId"?

field.name: description
field.value: A semicolon-separated list of folder-names (relative to 'wwwDir') containing static resources such as images or pdfs

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "assetsDir"?

field.name: description
field.value: The name of the application which is responsible for the authentication

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authApplication"?

field.name: description
field.value: The names of the login-pages (comma-separated) within the application defined in 'authApplication'. The number of comma-separated pages must be the same as in 'authLoginRef', because 'authLoginRef[n]' refers to 'authLoginPage[n]'!

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLoginPage"?

field.name: description
field.value: The action names (comma-separated) for the pages defined in {@link #AUTH_LOGIN_PAGE}. The number of comma-separated names must be the same as in 'authLoginPage', because 'authLoginRef[n]' refers to 'authLoginPage[n]'!

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLoginRef"?

field.name: description
field.value: The name for the parameter defining the action on the logout-page

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLogoutActionName"?

field.name: description
field.value: The value for the parameter defining the action on the logout-page

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLogoutActionValue"?

field.name: description
field.value: The name of the logout-page within the application defined in 'authApplication'

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLogoutPage"?

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "authLogoutRef"?

field.name: description
field.value: a comma-separated list of HTTP-methods to enable CSRF protection for

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "csrfProtectedMethods"?

field.name: description
field.value: a comma-separated list of path-prefixes to enable CSRF protection for

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "csrfProtectedPaths"?

field.name: description
field.value: Set to true to enable CSRF-protection for this site

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "csrfProtectionEnabled"?

field.name: description
field.value: The fully qualified name of a class implementing org.appng.core.repository.config.DatasourceConfigurer, which is responsible for JDBC connection-pooling. Supported are 'org.appng.core.repository.config.HikariCPConfigurer' and 'org.appng.core.repository.config.TomcatJdbcConfigurer'

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "DatasourceConfigurer"?

field.name: description
field.value: The application to be called after a successful login

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "defaultApplication"?

field.name: description
field.value: The name of the default-page (without extension) relative to one of the directories defined in 'documentDir'

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "defaultPage"?

field.name: description
field.value: The default page size (items per page)

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "defaultPageSize"?

field.name: description
field.value: A semicolon-separated list of folder-names (relative to 'wwwDir') containing JSP-files and static resources

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "documentDir"?

field.name: description
field.value: The time, in milliseconds, to wait for the filter before a LockTimeoutException is thrown

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "ehcacheBlockingTimeout"?

field.name: description
field.value: Whether or not the Ehcache is cleared on a site shutdown/reload

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "ehcacheClearOnShutdown"?

field.name: description
field.value: Set to true to enable Ehcache for this site

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "ehcacheEnabled"?

field.name: description
field.value: URL path prefixes which are never cached. Contains one prefix per line (CLOB value).

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "ehcacheExceptions"?

field.name: description
field.value: Set to true to enable Ehcache statistics

link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "ehcacheStatistics"?

link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "encoding"?

field.name: description
field.value: Set to true to enforce the protocol used by the site (http or https)

link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "enforcePrimaryDomain"?

field.name: description
field.value: The name of the default error-page (without extension) relative to 'wwwDir'

link.label: Delete
link.confirmation: Do you really want to delete the property "errorPage"?

link.label: Deactivate
link.confirmation: Do you really want to deactivate the application "${current.application.name}" for the site "${current.site.name}"? This causes the loss of the application's configuration for this site and -if the root database connection is manged- also of its data!
